Farhad Shirani
Research Assistant Professor
fsc265@nyu.edu

I am a Research Assistant Professor at the New York University Electrical and Computer Engineering department. I am also a member of NYU Wireless. I was employed as a lecturer and a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Michigan in 2017. I received my Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering at the University of Michigan in April 2017. My Ph.D. advisor was Sandeep Pradhan. I also received my M.Sc. in Applied Mathematics in 2016. My research interests are in the general areas of privacy and security, wireless communications, information theory, and learning theory.

For more information please find my CV.

I am on the academic job market seeking a tenure-track assistant professor position.

Biography:

I am a Research Assistant Professor at the New York University Electrical and Computer Engineering department. I am also a member of NYU Wireless. Prior to joining NYU, I was a lecturer and a postdoctoral researcher at the University of Michigan in Spring and Summber of 2017. I received my Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering at the University of Michigan in April 2017. My Ph.D. advisor was Prof. Sandeep Pradhan. I also received my M.Sc. in Applied Mathematics in 2016. My research interests are in the general areas of privacy and security, wireless communications, information theory, and learning theory.

For more information please find my CV.

I am on the academic job market seeking a tenure-track assistant professor position.

News:

10-01-2019: Our paper 'On the Sub-Optimality of Single-Letter Coding Over Networks' was published in the Ocrober issue of IEEE Transactions on Information Theory.  
 
10-01-2019: Our paper 'Quasi Structured Codes for Multi-Terminal Communications' was published in the Ocrober issue of IEEE Transactions on Information Theory.  
 
09-07-2019: I presented a tutorial on 'A Communication Theoretic Perspectivce on Web Privacy' at the PIMRC 2019 in Istanbul, Turkey.  
 
07-19-2019: Our tutorial proposal on 'A Communication Theoretic Perspectivce on Web Privacy' was accepted to be presented at the Globecom 2019 Conference in Hawaii, USA.  
 
07-05-2019: Our paper 'Opportunistic Temporal Fair Mode Selection and User Scheduling for Full-duplex Systems' was accepted to be presented at the PIMRC 2019 in Istanbul, Turkey.  
 
07-01-2019: I attended the ISIT 2019 Conference in Paris and presented our work on energy efficient MIMO communication ([1], [2]), multiuser scheduling ([3]), and database privacy ([4]).  
 
06-27-2019: I was invited to present our work on 'A New Framework for Web Privacy' in the GRAND workshop at the Maynooth University in Ireland. 
 
06-20-2019: Our paper 'A New Achievable Rate-Distortion Region for Distributed Source Coding' was submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory. 
 
04-30-2019 I was invited to present our work on "A Law of Small Numbers for Distributed Information Processing, Classification and Inference" at Nokia Bell Labs.  
 
03-31-2019: Our paper 'Tradeoff Between Delay and High SNR Capacity in Quantized MIMO Systems' was accepted to be presented at IEEE ISIT 2019. 
 
03-31-2019: Our paper 'On the Fundamental Limits of Multi-user Scheduling under Short-term Fairness Constraints' was accepted to be presented at IEEE ISIT 2019. 
 
03-31-2019: Our paper 'A Concentration of Measure Approach to Database De-anonymization' was accepted to be presented at IEEE ISIT 2019. 
 
03-31-2019: Our paper 'On Multiterminal Communication over MIMO Channels with One-bit ADCs at the Receivers' was accepted to be presented at IEEE ISIT 2019. 
 
01-22-2019: I was invited to present our work on database deanonymization in the ITA 2019 workshop. 
 
01-15-2019: Our paper 'On the Sub-optimality of Single-Letter Coding over Networks' which was submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory received a minor revision. 
01-11-2019:  A second revision of our paper 'A General Framework for Temporal Fair User Scheduling in NOMA Systems' was submitted to the Journal of Selected Topics in Signal Processing. 
 
18-11-2018: A second revision of 'How to Compute Modulo Prime-Power Sums?' was submitted to IEEE Transactions on Information Theory'. 
 
06-08-2018: A tutorial on our work 'An Information Theoretic Framework on Web Privacy' was presented in the 2018 IEEE East Asian School of Information Theory & Communication (EASITC)
